physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Postoperative electrocardiogram showed 'Cove'-type ST elevations and a right bundle branch block in precordial leads V1 and V2, indicating Brugada syndrome pattern.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: 48 hours after the Brugada pattern was noted, the electrocardiogram normalized.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood urea nitrogen increased to 39 mg/dL from baseline of 22 mg/dL; serum creatinine increased to 1.8 mg/dL from baseline of 0.9 mg/dL; peak serum potassium level 6.1 mg/dL.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Echocardiogram showed a mildly dilated left atrium, normal regional left ventricular wall motion, left ventricular ejection fraction of more than 55%, and trivial mitral regurgitation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Echocardiogram was unchanged compared to preoperative study.
